title: World Athletics Championships 2025: 100m finals, men’s 10,000m and more – live
summary: Daniel Harris is covering a bustling evening in Tokyo where numerous medals are at stake. The latest updates on the competitions will be provided. Stay tuned for highlights and results from the events.

title: ‘He’s way better than Mayweather’: Crawford hailed by Canelo after signature win
summary: Terence Crawford expressed that his win over Canelo Álvarez serves as vindication after facing years of skepticism. Meanwhile, Canelo acknowledged his struggle, stating he couldn't find a way to counter Crawford's strategy. The fight highlighted Crawford's skill and raised questions about Canelo's approach.

title: Wilder to return at Sheffield United after Sellés sacking, Manchester derby buildup – matchday live
summary: Stay updated with the latest developments in European football as matches unfold and teams compete in various leagues. Key events and player performances are making headlines on this action-packed day. Don't miss out on the thrilling moments and results from across the continent.

title: Sinfonia of London – weapons-grade energy and contagious dynamism
summary: Conductor John Wilson has elevated the orchestra to one of Britain’s finest. Violinist James Ehnes excelled as the soloist, delivering a performance that immediately soared. Their collaboration showcased exceptional musical talent and captivating chemistry.

title: Scale of ‘Unite the Kingdom’ march shows free speech ‘alive and well’ in UK, says minister – UK politics live
summary: Peter Kyle expressed that he was not troubled by the large far-right protest organized by Tommy Robinson. However, he condemned the violence directed towards the police during the event. Kyle's comments highlight a distinction between the protest itself and the unacceptable actions against law enforcement.
